title: Unit Circle $$1$$
text: The value inside the parenthesis of the cos refers to an angle which also corresponds to a point on the unit circle.

title: Unit Circle $$2$$
text: The angle $$\frac{4\pi}{3}$$ corresponds to the point $$(\left(-\frac{1}{2}\right),\left(-\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}\right))$$ on the unit circle.

title: Definition of trigonometric functions
text: Letting $$x$$ be an angle, sinx $$=$$ $$y$$, cosx $$=$$ $$x$$, and tanx $$=$$ $$\frac{y}{x}$$.

title: Combining
text: Based on the above information, what is the value of cos $$x$$ at the angle $$\frac{4\pi}{3}$$.
